timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure either, but it should be fine either way since this is our code.
replies.author: electrum

replies.bodyText: Given https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/master/presto-jdbc/src/main/java/io/prestosql/jdbc/PrestoPreparedStatement.java#L657, the first one won't be able to run. I will just use the second approach.
replies.author: puchengy

timeline.bodyText: There is no need for PrestoPreparedStatement to use PrestoDatabaseMetaData, so you can remove this method.
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: checkArgument takes a template that supports %s, so use that instead of string concatenation
timeline.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: I think this should return row (without parenthesis) to be consistent with array and map. This will need to be fixed in ClientTypeSignature to skip parenthesis if the arguments list is empty.
timeline.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: We should simply return varchar for the type rather than one with the max length, since that's consistent with how the types work in SQL in the engine. There are actually two varchar types, bounded and unbounded. This would be an unbounded type.
timeline.author: electrum

replies.bodyText:
@electrum To honor the current logic of constructing the column info (always assuming varchar has a parameter in the list) https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/master/presto-jdbc/src/main/java/io/prestosql/jdbc/ColumnInfo.java#L144
I will change the client output behavior in ClientTypeSignature
replies.author: puchengy

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't the condition be arguments.get(0).getLongLiteral() == Integer.MAX_VALUE  (UNBOUNDED_LENGTH) rather than ... = Integer.MAX_VALUE - 1 (MAX_LENGTH) ?
https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/d3a1d8ca12b84524cd2d6f88fceb9a9c53df9700/presto-spi/src/main/java/io/prestosql/spi/type/VarcharType.java#L32-L34
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: the else is redundant, since "then" block always returns
timeline.author: findepi
findepi
findepi

replies.bodyText: This still wouldn't be great (unbounded varchar doesn't have length), but i don't currently have a better name, so can be "VARCHAR_UNBOUNDED_LENGTH".
replies.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: there should be a comment explaining why we discard type parameters for array, map, row
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: @findepi Thanks! I added a TODO as a comment below base on the discussion we had before (which led us to a point that we only need top-level type currently): https://prestosql.slack.com/archives/CP1MUNEUX/p1570293305067000?thread_ts=1570147672.028700&cid=CP1MUNEUX
replies.author: puchengy

timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: This code is only used for metadata display purposes, so I don't think we want to fail here. Seems fine to ignore anything that is not supported.
replies.author: electrum
